benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Transfer a bundle to another account

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios cover successful transfers with minimum fields, all optional parameters, billingPolicy variants, requestedDate, pluginProperty arrays, and optional headers (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC18, TC26).
Invalid Payload / Validation: Tests cover invalid bundleId format, invalid requestedDate, invalid billingPolicy, missing required headers and missing request body (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12).
Resource Not Found: Scenarios for non-existent bundle and non-existent target account are present (TC06, TC07, TC22, TC23).
Authentication/Authorization: Unauthorized access case is present (TC13 -> 401).
Error Handling: Service/unavailable and inconsistent dependency error scenarios are present (TC14 -> 503, TC24 -> 500).
Response Expectations: Tests assert expected 201 on success, response body as Bundle, and Location header presence/contents in primary success scenarios (TC01, TC02).
Security: Input attack vectors are considered (SQL injection in accountId TC15, XSS in pluginProperty TC16).

Edge cases & robustness: Extra unsupported params, empty pluginProperty array, large pluginProperty payload, transfer to same account, empty DB / partial DB states are covered (TC19, TC18, TC20, TC25, TC22, TC23).
Performance & Concurrency: Response time and concurrent request scenarios are included (TC27, TC28, TC29, TC30).
Recovery: Transient network failure retry is covered (TC17).
Accessibility / Messages: A scenario exists addressing documentation and error messages (TC31).
gaps: Duplicate submission / Idempotency: No scenario verifies handling of duplicate POST submissions (e.g., safe replays, idempotency token behavior, or 409 conflict on repeated transfers).
Content-Type / Accept header handling and malformed JSON: No tests that send wrong Content-Type or malformed/non-JSON bodies to verify 400 handling or content negotiation.
AccountId format validation in body (UUID): While non-existent account is tested, there is no explicit test for invalid target accountId format (non-UUID) producing 400.

Response schema and header strictness: Limited checks on the exact Bundle JSON schema fields, Content-Type response header, and precise Location URL pattern/format; existing tests assert presence but not full schema validation.

Concurrency race on same bundle: While concurrent requests are covered generally (TC29), there is no explicit test for conflicting simultaneous transfers of the same bundle (expecting conflict handling or transactional guarantees).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for system behaviour under rate limits (429) or abuse protection.
Header size / boundary negative tests: Maximum length negative tests for X-Killbill-Reason / Comment beyond allowed sizes (only positive max-length test exists TC21).

Large payload negative outcomes & resource limits: TC20 covers large pluginProperty payload but there are no explicit tests for overall request size limits (e.g., huge JSON body leading to 413) beyond the pluginProperty specific case.
Authorization granularity: No tests for permission/role-based denial (403) — only general unauthenticated 401 is covered.
recommendations: Add idempotency / duplicate-submission tests: simulate repeated POSTs for the same transfer request (with and without idempotency token) to ensure duplicates are handled gracefully or return appropriate 4xx/409 responses.
Test Content-Type and malformed JSON: include negative tests that send non-JSON bodies and incorrect Content-Type headers to verify 400 handling and clear error messages.
Add accountId format validation tests: send non-UUID strings as accountId in body and assert 400 with descriptive validation errors.
Tighten response schema validation: assert required Bundle fields, types, and values in the response body and verify response Content-Type and that Location URL matches expected pattern.

Simulate conflicting concurrent transfers on the same bundle: produce two simultaneous transfer requests for the same bundle and assert one succeeds while the other fails safely (e.g., 409 or well-documented error), ensuring transactional integrity.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: run burst requests to validate 429 handling and appropriate Retry-After headers / throttling behaviour.
Add negative header boundary tests: send overly large X-Killbill-Reason / X-Killbill-Comment headers to confirm they are rejected or handled per spec.
Expand large-payload tests beyond pluginProperty: include very large JSON bodies and verify either successful handling or a 413 response and graceful failure modes.
Add permission/authorization tests (403): verify authenticated users without required privileges receive appropriate forbidden responses, if applicable.
